inlineContent.text: This framework was written to allow integration of Nix devices into third-party iOS and macOS applications. It provides tools to discover nearby Nix devices, open a connection, perform measurements, and obtain data. Tools are also provided for basic colour conversions and colour difference calculations.
The latest version of this documentation is available
and the latest verion of the library is available on
For changes introduced in this version, please refer to the
If you are upgrading to version 4.2.x or newer from an earlier version, you will need update your application to activate your SDK license. See
framework. These two libraries should not be used together; remove the
library from your project before adding

USB connectivity supported on macOS only
Active internet connection for device activation (demo / evaluation versions only)
Review the step-by-step guide provided in the

The quick start guide is not intended as an exhaustive reference. Please also refer to the API references included below for further details on the classes and methods provided by the Nix Universal SDK.
If you encounter any issues with SDK implementation, please contact us via e-mail at

Limited anonymous usage data is tracked by the Nix Universal SDK using Google Analytics. No personal user data, color data, or any data which uniquely identifies an individual Nix device is collected. Collected data is subject to the Nix Apps
. Events and usage data tracked by the Nix SDK are solely limited to the following information:
Device type (e.g. - Nix Pro, Nix Mini, etc)
